tuv.seg: Lighting of motorcycles in Ireland
Soilsiú gluaisrothar in Éirinn
If you wish to ride a motorcycle on a public road in Ireland, you should be aware there are specific rules in place about the type of lamps and reflectors that must be fitted to your motorcycle

Más mian leat gluaisrothair a thiomáint ar bhóthar poiblí in Éirinn ba cheart duit a bheith ar an eolas go bhfuil rialacha faoi leith i bhfeidhm maidir leis an gcineál lampaí agus frithneoirí nach mór a bheith ar an ngluaisrothar
These provisions are set down in the Road Traffic (Lighting of Vehicles) Regulations, 1963 (as amended)
Tá na rialacha seo leagtha síos sna Rialacháin um Thrácht ar Bhóithre (Soilsiú Feithiclí), 1963
Effective use of lighting on your motorcycle will ensure that other road users see you
Má bhíonn soilse éifeachtacha ar do ghluaisrothar cinnteófar go bhfuil úsáideoirí eile bóthair in ann tú a fheiceáil
The Gardai (Irish police force) are responsible for the enforcement of the law on the lighting of vehicles in Ireland and this enforcement is essential for road safety

Tá an Garda Síochána (poilíní na hÉireann) freagrach as an dlí a bhaineann le soilsiú feithiclí in Éirinn a chur i bhfeidhm agus tá sé riachtanach go ndéantar é seo le sábháilteacht a chinntiú ar na bóithre
The object of these Regulations is to prevent accidents and protect life and property
Tá sé mar aidhm ag na Rialacháin seo timpistí a sheachaint agus beatha agus maoin a chosaint
Motorcycles at all times are required to have:
Ní mór go mbeadh na nithe seo a leanas ar ghluaisrothar an t-am ar fad:

• One head lamp: this is a lamp that when lit, adequately lights the road ahead with a white or yellow light for a distance of 99 metres (325 feet) (or 30.5 metres (100 feet) when dipped) and in the case of a low-powered motorcycle, a reasonable distance

• Ceannlampa amháin: lampa é seo a dhéanann an bóthar a shoilsiú mar is cuí le solas geal nó buí ar feadh achair de 325 troigh (nó 100 troigh nuair atá sé íslithe) agus i gcás gluaisrothair de chumhacht íseal, ar feadh achair réasúnta
• One rear lamp: this is a lamp fitted to the rear and when lit, a red light is visible for 152 metres (500 feet)
• Cúl-lampa amháin: lampa é seo atá ar chúl an rothair agus nuair atá sé lasta, tá solas dearg le feiceáil ar feadh 500 troigh
• One rear reflector: this is a red reflector that can be plainly seen for a distance of 99 metres (325 feet) to the rear when the headlights of a vehicle shine directly on it
• Frithneoir cúil amháin: frithneoir dearg atá le feiceáil go soiléar ar feadh achair de 325 troigh ar do chúl nuair atá ceannlampaí feithicle ag soilsiú go díreach air

• Identification mark lighting: this is a white light illuminating the rear identification plate so that each letter and number is easily distinguishable for a distance of 20 metres (65 feet) to the rear
• Soilsiú ar an uimhirphláta: solas geal lasta ar an uimhirphláta cúil atá anseo ionas gur féidir gach litir agus uimhir a léamh go héasca ó achar de 65 troigh ar an gcúl

• Position lamp (if not fitted with a head lamp or if a side car is attached): this is a lamp not exceeding 7 watts that is fitted not more than 1.5 metres (5 feet) from the ground and which when lit shows to the front a white light visible for 152 metres (500 feet)

• Lampa suímh (muna bhfuil ceannlampa ann nó má tá taobhcharr ar an ngluaisrothar): lampa é seo nach mó ná 7 vat atá ar an ngluaisrothar nach mó ná 5 troigh ón talamh agus nuair atá sé lasta a thaispeáineann solas geal chun tosaigh atá le feiceáil ar feadh 500 troigh

• Direction indicators and high mounted stop lamp (this is optional): A direction indicator is a device fitted to a motorcycle that is capable of indicating to the other road users that the driver intends to turn right or left

• Treo-tháscairí agus stad lampa ard (níl sé seo riachtanach): lampa ar an ngluaisrothar é treo-tháscaire a thaispeáineann d'úsáideoirí eile bóthair go bhfuil sé ar intinn ag an tiománaí casadh ar dheis nó ar chlé
Indicators must be either semaphore or flashing
Ní mór go mbeadh treo-tháscairí séamafórach nó gealánach
Side-cars of motorcycles are required at all times to have:
Ní mór go mbeadh na nithe seo a leanas ar thaobhcharranna gluaisrothar an t-am ar fad:
• One rear lamp (as above)
• Cúl-lampa amháin (mar thuas)
The head lamps on your motorcycle should be dipped in good time in the following situations:
Ba cheart na ceannlampaí ar do ghluaisrothar a ísliú go maith in am sna cúinsí seo a leanas:
• Meeting oncoming vehicles (i.e., vehicles coming towards you from the opposite direction)
• Nuair atá feithiclí ag teacht i do choinne (nuair atá feithiclí ag teacht i do threo ón treo eile)
• In built-up areas where public lighting is provided, and special speed limit areas
• In áiteanna faoi fhoirgnimh ina bhfuil soilse poiblí, agus i gceantair faoi luasteorainn speisialta
• In periods of poor visibility (i.e., heavy fog, snow, rain, dust)
• Nuair atá an léargas go dona (mar shampla le ceo trom, sneachta, báisteach nó dusta)
• Travelling behind another vehicle
• Nuair atá tú ag taisteal taobh thiar de fheithicil eile
• When failing to use your head lamps may cause inconvenience to other road users
• Nuair a d'fhéadfadh sé ciotaí a dhéanamh d'úsáideoirí eile bóthair má theipeann ort úsáid á bhaint as do cheannlampaí
All motorcyclists are required to use lamps (other than stop lamps) during "lighting-up" hours
Ní mór do ghluaisrothaithe uilig lampaí a úsáid (ach amháin stop-lampaí) i rith uaireanta "soilsiúcháin"
If you are using your motorcycle during the day when visibility is poor, you are also required to use lamps
Má tá tú ag baint úsáide as an ngluaisrothar sa lá nuair atá an léargas lag, ní mor duit lampaí a úsáid freisin
If you are using lamps on your motorcycle, you should ensure that your lights are dipped when approaching other road users
Má tá lampaí in úsáid ar do ghluaisrothar agat, ba cheart duit déanamh cinnte na soilse a ísliú nuair atá tú ag teacht i dtreo úsáideoirí eile bóthair
Most motorcycles are fitted with these lamps and reflectors as standard
Bíonn na lampaí agus frithneoirí seo ar formhór na ngluaisrothar nuair a dhéantar iad
You can purchase replacement lamps at any reputable motorcycle shop
Is féidir lampaí breise a cheannach ag aon siopa maith gluaisrothair
If you are unsure about whether your motorcycle conforms to the law, you should contact your nearest Garda station for advice and information
Muna bhfuil tú cinnte an bhfuil do ghluaisrothar ag cloí leis an dlí ba cheart duit teagmháil a dhéanamh leis an stáisiún Garda áitiúil le comhairle agus eolas a fháil
